candidates.name: Caitlin Casey
candidates.why_elect: Hopefully after 20 years of running a Yoga school and focusing on the wellness of people and walking with all walks of life will enable me to hear the true call of the people of Te Aroha's needs. Then try my best to have them activated.
candidates.why_stand: I love Te Aroha, we chose Te Aroha over many other towns because of its special "vibe". Here the mountain just gives so much Aroha and it is reflected in the kindness of the local people. But the town is not thriving and needs attention, let us all try.

candidates.name: Teena Cornes
candidates.why_elect: I care about the community I live in and I'm the first person to always make sure that everyone gets a say. Advocacy is important and ensures the majority are represented.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that in order for a council to function at a strong governance level, we need to maintain consistency and support around the table. I haven't finished some of the projects that I am involved in and would like the opportunity to do so.

candidates.name: Ken Mahon
candidates.why_elect: I have business experience second to none, been a City Councillor previously and understand what is required at the present time.
candidates.why_stand: Running for election to use my expertise as a Turnaround expert to further the goals and prosperity of Te Aroha by creating new businesses, bringing events to town and filling the empty shops.

candidates.name: Russell Smith
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Te Aroha for 25 years, I spent 15 years in the NZ Army and was also a solo parent for 7 years. I was president of the Te Aroha RSA for 7 years and I am also a life member of the RSA.
candidates.why_stand: I believe with my life experiences and attributes I have what it takes to become an effective councillor. I believe Te Aroha is a great gold mine of a town that just needs to be managed correctly, with tourism and creating a reason for the current generations to stay.

candidates.name: Garry Voogt
candidates.why_elect: I'm used to making things happen and have governance experience on a variety of organisations. I'm good at listening and consider everyone's views. I'm a hard worker and will put 100% effort into serving the community I'm part of.
candidates.why_stand: Matamata-Piako is a great place to live but I think we can make it better and I'm keen to play my part. I would like to see Te Aroha revitalised again to the thriving commercial town it once was.
